pli-tv-pvr13:1.1.eng: The investigator should ask the accuser:

pli-tv-pvr13:1.2.pli: “yaṃ kho tvaṃ, āvuso, imaṃ bhikkhuṃ codesi, kimhi naṃ codesi, sīlavipattiyā vā codesi, ācāravipattiyā vā codesi, diṭṭhivipattiyā vā codesī”ti?
pli-tv-pvr13:1.2.eng: “Do you accuse this monk of failure in morality, conduct, or view?”

pli-tv-pvr13:1.4.pli: “sīlavipattiyā vā codemi, ācāravipattiyā vā codemi, diṭṭhivipattiyā vā codemī”ti, so evamassa vacanīyo—
pli-tv-pvr13:1.4.eng: “I am accusing him of failure in morality,” “I am accusing him of failure in conduct,” or “I am accusing him of failure in view,” he should be asked,

pli-tv-pvr13:1.5.pli: “jānāsi panāyasmā sīlavipattiṃ, jānāsi ācāravipattiṃ, jānāsi diṭṭhivipattin”ti?
pli-tv-pvr13:1.5.eng: “Do you know what failure in morality is?” “Do you know what failure in conduct is?” or “Do you know what failure in view is?”

pli-tv-pvr13:1.7.pli: “jānāmi kho ahaṃ, āvuso, sīlavipattiṃ, jānāmi ācāravipattiṃ, jānāmi diṭṭhivipattin”ti, so evamassa vacanīyo—
pli-tv-pvr13:1.7.eng: “I do,” he should be asked what they are.

pli-tv-pvr13:1.12.pli: “cattāri ca pārājikāni, terasa ca saṅghādisesā, ayaṃ sīlavipatti.
pli-tv-pvr13:1.12.eng: “The four offenses entailing expulsion and the thirteen entailing suspension are failure in morality,”

pli-tv-pvr13:1.13.pli: Thullaccayaṃ, pācittiyaṃ, pāṭidesanīyaṃ, dukkaṭaṃ, dubbhāsitaṃ, ayaṃ ācāravipatti.
pli-tv-pvr13:1.13.eng: “The serious offenses, the offenses entailing confession, the offenses entailing acknowledgment, the offenses of wrong conduct, and the offenses of wrong speech are failure in conduct,”

pli-tv-pvr13:1.14.pli: Micchādiṭṭhi, antaggāhikā diṭṭhi, ayaṃ diṭṭhivipattī”ti, so evamassa vacanīyo—
pli-tv-pvr13:1.14.eng: “Wrong views and extreme views are failure in view,” he should be asked,

pli-tv-pvr13:1.15.pli: “yaṃ kho tvaṃ, āvuso, imaṃ bhikkhuṃ codesi, diṭṭhena vā codesi sutena vā codesi parisaṅkāya vā codesī”ti?
pli-tv-pvr13:1.15.eng: “Are you accusing this monk because of what you’ve seen, what you’ve heard, or what you suspect?”

pli-tv-pvr13:1.17.pli: “diṭṭhena vā codemi sutena vā codemi parisaṅkāya vā codemī”ti, so evamassa vacanīyo—
pli-tv-pvr13:1.17.eng: “I’m accusing him because of what I’ve seen,” “I’m accusing him because of what I’ve heard,” or “I’m accusing him because of what I suspect,” he should be asked,

pli-tv-pvr13:1.18.pli: “yaṃ kho tvaṃ, āvuso, imaṃ bhikkhuṃ diṭṭhena codesi, kiṃ te diṭṭhaṃ kinti te diṭṭhaṃ, kadā te diṭṭhaṃ, kattha te diṭṭhaṃ pārājikaṃ ajjhāpajjanto diṭṭho, saṅghādisesaṃ ajjhāpajjanto diṭṭho, thullaccayaṃ …
pli-tv-pvr13:1.18.eng: “Since you’re accusing this monk because of what you’ve seen, what have you seen? How did you see it? When did you see it? Where did you see it? Did you see him commit an offense entailing expulsion? Did you see him commit an offense entailing suspension? Did you see him commit a serious offense?

pli-tv-pvr13:1.22.pli: dubbhāsitaṃ ajjhāpajjanto diṭṭho, kattha ca tvaṃ ahosi, kattha cāyaṃ bhikkhu ahosi, kiñca tvaṃ karosi, kiṃ cāyaṃ bhikkhu karotī”ti?
pli-tv-pvr13:1.22.eng: … an offense of wrong speech? Where were you? Where was this monk? What were you doing? What was this monk doing?”

pli-tv-pvr13:1.24.pli: “na kho ahaṃ, āvuso, imaṃ bhikkhuṃ diṭṭhena codemi, api ca sutena codemī”ti, so evamassa vacanīyo—
pli-tv-pvr13:1.24.eng: “I didn’t accuse this monk because of what I’ve seen, but because of what I’ve heard,” he should be asked,

pli-tv-pvr13:1.25.pli: “yaṃ kho tvaṃ, āvuso, imaṃ bhikkhuṃ sutena codesi, kiṃ te sutaṃ, kinti te sutaṃ, kadā te sutaṃ, kattha te sutaṃ, pārājikaṃ ajjhāpannoti sutaṃ, saṅghādisesaṃ …
pli-tv-pvr13:1.25.eng: “Since you’re accusing this monk because of what you’ve heard, what have you heard? How did you hear it? When did you hear it? Where did you hear it? Did you hear that he has committed an offense entailing expulsion? Did you hear that he has committed an offense entailing suspension?

pli-tv-pvr13:1.30.pli: dubbhāsitaṃ ajjhāpannoti sutaṃ, bhikkhussa sutaṃ, bhikkhuniyā sutaṃ, sikkhamānāya sutaṃ, sāmaṇerassa sutaṃ, sāmaṇeriyā sutaṃ, upāsakassa sutaṃ, upāsikāya sutaṃ, rājūnaṃ sutaṃ, rājamahāmattānaṃ sutaṃ, titthiyānaṃ sutaṃ, titthiyasāvakānaṃ sutan”ti?
pli-tv-pvr13:1.30.eng: Did you hear that he has committed an offense of wrong speech? Did you hear it from a monk, a nun, a trainee nun, a novice monk, a novice nun, a male lay follower, or a female lay follower? Or did you hear it from kings, a king’s officials, the monastics of another religion, or the lay followers of another religion?”

pli-tv-pvr13:1.32.pli: “na kho ahaṃ, āvuso, imaṃ bhikkhuṃ sutena codemi, api ca parisaṅkāya codemī”ti, so evamassa vacanīyo—
pli-tv-pvr13:1.32.eng: “I didn’t accuse this monk because of what I’ve heard, but because of what I suspect,” he should be asked,

pli-tv-pvr13:1.33.pli: “yaṃ kho tvaṃ, āvuso, imaṃ bhikkhuṃ parisaṅkāya codesi, kiṃ parisaṅkasi, kinti parisaṅkasi, kadā parisaṅkasi, kattha parisaṅkasi, pārājikaṃ ajjhāpannoti parisaṅkasi, saṅghādisesaṃ ajjhāpannoti parisaṅkasi, thullaccayaṃ …
pli-tv-pvr13:1.33.eng: “Since you’re accusing this monk because of suspicion, what do you suspect? How do you suspect it? When did you suspect it? Where did you suspect it? Do you suspect that he has committed an offense entailing expulsion? Do you suspect that he has committed an offense entailing suspension? Do you suspect that he has committed a serious offense?

pli-tv-pvr13:1.37.pli: dubbhāsitaṃ ajjhāpannoti parisaṅkasi, bhikkhussa sutvā parisaṅkasi, bhikkhuniyā sutvā parisaṅkasi, sikkhamānāya sutvā parisaṅkasi, sāmaṇerassa sutvā parisaṅkasi, sāmaṇeriyā sutvā parisaṅkasi, upāsakassa sutvā parisaṅkasi, upāsikāya sutvā parisaṅkasi, rājūnaṃ sutvā parisaṅkasi, rājamahāmattānaṃ sutvā parisaṅkasi, titthiyānaṃ sutvā parisaṅkasi, titthiyasāvakānaṃ sutvā parisaṅkasī”ti?
pli-tv-pvr13:1.37.eng: Do you suspect that he has committed an offense of wrong speech? Do you suspect it after hearing about it from a monk, a nun, a trainee nun, a novice monk, a novice nun, a male lay follower, or a female lay follower? Or do you suspect it after hearing about it from kings, a king’s officials, the monastics of another religion, or the lay followers of another religion?”

pli-tv-pvr13:2.1.eng: If what he saw agrees with what he says he saw,
pli-tv-pvr13:2.1.comm: Sp 5.361: Tattha diṭṭhaṁ diṭṭhenāti gāthāya ayamattho – ekeneko mātugāmena saddhiṁ ekaṭṭhānato nikkhamanto vā pavisanto vā diṭṭho, so taṁ pārājikena codeti, itaro tassa dassanaṁ anujānāti. Taṁ pana dassanaṁ paṭicca pārājikaṁ na upeti, na paṭijānāti. Evamettha yaṁ tena diṭṭhaṁ, taṁ tassa “diṭṭho mayā”ti iminā diṭṭhavacanena sameti, “The meaning of diṭṭhaṁ diṭṭhena in the verse is this: a monk is seen emerging or entering a place alone with a woman, and one accuses him of an offense entailing expulsion, and the monk admits to what the other has seen. What was seen does not amount to an offense entailing expulsion, and he does not admit to it. So in this case, what was seen by him agrees with his statement, ‘It was seen by me.’”

pli-tv-pvr13:2.2.eng: If they correspond with each other,

pli-tv-pvr13:2.3.eng: But what was seen is not adequate to prove the accusation,

pli-tv-pvr13:2.6.eng: And they should then do the observance-day ceremony with him.

pli-tv-pvr13:3.1.eng: If what he heard agrees with what he says he heard,

pli-tv-pvr13:3.2.eng: If they correspond with each other,

pli-tv-pvr13:3.3.eng: But what was heard is not adequate to prove the accusation,

pli-tv-pvr13:3.6.eng: And they should then do the observance-day ceremony with him.

pli-tv-pvr13:4.1.eng: If what he sensed agrees with what he says he sensed,

pli-tv-pvr13:4.2.eng: If they correspond with each other,

pli-tv-pvr13:4.3.eng: But what was sensed is not adequate to prove the accusation,

pli-tv-pvr13:4.6.eng: And they should then do the observance-day ceremony with him.

pli-tv-pvr13:5.1.pli: Codanāya ko ādi, kiṃ majjhe, kiṃ pariyosānaṃ?
pli-tv-pvr13:5.1.eng: What is the beginning, the middle, and the end of an accusation?

pli-tv-pvr13:5.2.pli: Codanāya okāsakammaṃ ādi, kiriyā majjhe, samatho pariyosānaṃ.
pli-tv-pvr13:5.2.eng: Getting permission for the accusation is the beginning, doing it is the middle, settling it is the end.

pli-tv-pvr13:5.3.pli: Codanāya kati mūlāni, kati vatthūni, kati bhūmiyo, katihākārehi codeti?
pli-tv-pvr13:5.3.eng: How many roots does accusing have, how many bases, and how many grounds? And in how many ways does one accuse?

pli-tv-pvr13:5.4.pli: Codanāya dve mūlāni, tīṇi vatthūni, pañca bhūmiyo, dvīhākārehi codeti.
pli-tv-pvr13:5.4.eng: It has two roots, three bases, and five grounds. And one accuses in two ways.

pli-tv-pvr13:5.6.eng: With a root and without a root.

pli-tv-pvr13:5.9.eng: The seen, the heard, and the suspected.

pli-tv-pvr13:5.12.pli: Kālena vakkhāmi no akālena, bhūtena vakkhāmi no abhūtena, saṇhena vakkhāmi no pharusena, atthasaṃhitena vakkhāmi no anatthasaṃhitena, mettācitto vakkhāmi no dosantaroti—
pli-tv-pvr13:5.12.eng: “I’ll speak at an appropriate time, not at an inappropriate one; I’ll speak the truth, not falsehood; I’ll speak gently, not harshly; I’ll speak what’s beneficial, not what’s unbeneficial; I’ll speak with a mind of good will, not with ill will.”

pli-tv-pvr13:6.1.eng: What are the two ways of accusing?

pli-tv-pvr13:6.2.pli: Kāyena vā codeti vācāya vā codeti—
pli-tv-pvr13:6.2.eng: One accuses by body or by speech.

pli-tv-pvr13:7.0.eng: 2. The proceeding of an accuser, etc.

pli-tv-pvr13:7.6.pli: Codakena pañcasu dhammesu patiṭṭhāya paro codetabbo.
pli-tv-pvr13:7.6.eng: The accuser should set up five qualities before accusing another:

pli-tv-pvr13:7.7.pli: Kālena vakkhāmi no akālena, bhūtena vakkhāmi no abhūtena, saṇhena vakkhāmi no pharusena, atthasaṃhitena vakkhāmi no anatthasaṃhitena, mettācitto vakkhāmi no dosantaroti—
pli-tv-pvr13:7.7.eng: “I’ll speak at an appropriate time, not at an inappropriate one; I’ll speak the truth, not falsehood; I’ll speak gently, not harshly; I’ll speak what’s beneficial, not what’s unbeneficial; I’ll speak with a mind of good will, not with ill will.”

pli-tv-pvr13:7.10.eng: The accused should set up two qualities:

pli-tv-pvr13:7.14.eng: The Sangha should know what has been brought before it and what has not.
pli-tv-pvr13:7.14.comm: Sp 5.363: Otiṇṇānotiṇṇaṁ jānitabbanti otiṇṇañca anotiṇṇañca vacanaṁ jānitabbaṁ. Tatrāyaṁ jānanavidhi – ettakā codakassa pubbakathā, ettakā pacchimakathā, ettakā cuditakassa pubbakathā, ettakā pacchimakathāti jānitabbā. Codakassa pamāṇaṁ gaṇhitabbaṁ, cuditakassa pamāṇaṁ gaṇhitabbaṁ, anuvijjakassa pamāṇaṁ gaṇhitabbaṁ, anuvijjako appamattakampi ahāpento “āvuso samannāharitvā ujuṁ katvā āharā”ti vattabbo, saṅghena evaṁ paṭipajjitabbaṁ, “Otiṇṇānotiṇṇaṁ jānitabbaṁ: a statement is to be known as otiṇṇa or anotiṇṇa. This is the way of knowing: ‘The accuser should say this first and that afterwards. The accused should say this first and that afterwards.’ This is to be known. The accuser is to be assessed, so is the accused and the investigator. If the investigator mangles (his speech) even a little, he should be told, ‘Reflect, fix it up, and then speak.’ This how the Sangha should proceed.”

pli-tv-pvr13:7.17.pli: Anuvijjakena yena dhammena yena vinayena yena satthusāsanena taṃ adhikaraṇaṃ vūpasammati tathā taṃ adhikaraṇaṃ vūpasametabbaṃ.
pli-tv-pvr13:7.17.eng: The investigator resolves that legal issue in accordance with the Teaching, the Monastic Law, and the Teacher’s instruction.

pli-tv-pvr13:8.1.eng: What is the purpose of the observance-day ceremony?

pli-tv-pvr13:8.2.eng: Why is there an invitation ceremony?

pli-tv-pvr13:8.3.eng: What is the purpose of probation?

pli-tv-pvr13:8.4.eng: Why is there a sending back to the beginning?

pli-tv-pvr13:8.5.eng: What is the purpose of the trial period?

pli-tv-pvr13:9.1.eng: The purpose of the observance-day ceremony is unity.

pli-tv-pvr13:9.2.eng: The purpose of the invitation ceremony is purity.

pli-tv-pvr13:9.3.eng: The purpose of probation is the trial period.

pli-tv-pvr13:9.4.eng: The purpose of sending back to the beginning is restraint.

pli-tv-pvr13:9.5.eng: The purpose of the trial period is rehabilitation.

pli-tv-pvr13:9.6.eng: The purpose of rehabilitation is purity.

pli-tv-pvr13:10.1.eng: If, because of desire, ill will, fear, or confusion,

pli-tv-pvr13:10.3.eng: Then, when the body breaks up, that foolish person,

pli-tv-pvr13:11.1.eng: But not depending on worldly gain,

pli-tv-pvr13:11.2.comm: Sp 5.364: Na ca nissāya puggalanti “ayaṁ me upajjhāyo vā ācariyo vā”tiādinā nayena chandādīhi gacchanto puggalaṁ nissāya karoti, evaṁ na kareyya, “Not depending on individuals: through the method that begins with thinking, ‘This is my preceptor or teacher,’ one does not create dependence on an individual through desire, etc.”

pli-tv-pvr13:11.4.eng: One should act according to the Teaching.

pli-tv-pvr13:12.3.eng: He charges a non-offender with an offense—

pli-tv-pvr13:13.1.eng: Whispering in the ear, looking for flaws,

pli-tv-pvr13:13.2.comm: SN-a 1.188: Vītiharatīti katassa paṭikāraṁ karoti, “Vītiharati: he acts with a counter-action toward the one who has acted.”

pli-tv-pvr13:13.3.eng: He charges a non-offender with an offense—

pli-tv-pvr13:14.1.eng: Accusing at the wrong time, untruthfully,

pli-tv-pvr13:14.3.eng: With a mind of ill will, not a mind of good will,

pli-tv-pvr13:14.4.eng: He charges a non-offender with an offense—

pli-tv-pvr13:15.1.eng: Not knowing the Teaching and what is contrary to it,

pli-tv-pvr13:15.3.eng: He charges a non-offender with an offense—

pli-tv-pvr13:16.1.eng: Not knowing the Monastic Law and what is contrary to it,

pli-tv-pvr13:16.3.eng: He charges a non-offender with an offense—

pli-tv-pvr13:17.1.eng: Not knowing what was spoken and what was not,

pli-tv-pvr13:17.3.eng: He charges a non-offender with an offense—

pli-tv-pvr13:18.1.eng: Not knowing what was practiced and what was not,

pli-tv-pvr13:18.3.eng: He charges a non-offender with an offense—

pli-tv-pvr13:19.1.eng: Not knowing what was laid down and what was not,

pli-tv-pvr13:19.3.eng: He charges a non-offender with an offense—

pli-tv-pvr13:20.1.eng: Not knowing the offenses and the non-offenses,

pli-tv-pvr13:20.3.eng: He charges a non-offender with an offense—

pli-tv-pvr13:21.1.eng: Not knowing light and heavy offenses,

pli-tv-pvr13:21.3.eng: He charges a non-offender with an offense—

pli-tv-pvr13:22.1.eng: Not knowing curable and incurable offenses,

pli-tv-pvr13:22.3.eng: He charges a non-offender with an offense—

pli-tv-pvr13:23.1.eng: Not knowing grave and minor offenses,

pli-tv-pvr13:23.3.eng: He charges a non-offender with an offense—

pli-tv-pvr13:24.3.eng: He charges a non-offender with an offense—

pli-tv-pvr13:25.1.eng: Not knowing the sequence of statements,

pli-tv-pvr13:25.3.eng: He charges a non-offender with an offense—

pli-tv-pvr13:26.1.eng: The process of investigation  is finished.

pli-tv-pvr13:28.2.eng: Beginning, at the root, observance day,
